item.title: Mkisofs
item.description: A recent project that involved working with a Windows 98 installation running in emulation (QEMU) needed an update installed from a .exe. Needing to get the .exe from my desktop into the Windows 98 environment posed a problem to solve. There are likely many solutions to this problem, the one I found, with the quickest resolution was to create a .iso formatted disk image (iso9660) to mount as a cdrom in the emulated environment.

item.title: Diagrams
item.description: Many times throughout the life of a project I find the need to create some visual component to go along with planning or communicating about some component of a system or technology. After coming to this conclusion, the next step is so often a question of what tool to use for the task! I have used several solutions that broadly fall into two categories: text-based and graphics-based. On the text-based side I’ve been really enjoying using plantuml for creating various types of diagrams specified in text converted to an image.

item.title: init_post
item.description: Welcome! The plan for this space is to host semi-public, informal notes documenting various digital preservation, software development, and technology-related topics.
